subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4.0 release candidate 2
msgSnippet: ...  This is awesome work. I feel stupid now for not having stepped forward to participate more, but in hindsight, I would have just overcommitted and
messageBody:
David Saff wrote:

> The first and most important point is this: early adopters, 99% of your
> JUnit 4 test cases still work, and now work better than before!
<snip />

This is awesome work. I feel stupid now for not having stepped forward
to participate more, but in hindsight, I would have just overcommitted
and underdelivered....

I look forward to trying out this release.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
